resources.string: SciStarter Sign in or Sign up
Welcome! Thanks for helping us build a World Water Health Map.
We\'re sorry, WaterInsights does not support your device.
By signing in, you can keep track of the water you\'ve tested on your SciStarter Dashboard.
Please enter a valid email address
Don\'t have a SciStarter account? Click here to register for one now.
Here\'s a summary of what you\'ll be doing

Things you\'ll need:
• Test strip (don\'t open it until it\'s time to do the test)
• Black color card
• White color chart
• Recent (less than an hour old) water sample
- don\'t open it until it\'s time to do the test

Gather a water sample in a container you\'d be comfortable drinking from. To test your water sample, you\'ll need to submerge an entire test strip in the water for about 1 second. Take it out, start the timer in the app, and place the strip on the test card. Make sure it is oriented as shown on the test card. Try to place the test strip as straight as possible in the space indicated on the card.

When the timer ends, the app will enable you to take a picture of the strip and card. We\'ll analyze that image and tell you about your water quality. We\'ll also upload the data to a cloud server where we can study trends in water bodies worldwide! You will be contributing to a World Water Health Map!
Let\'s get some info about the water you\'re testing.
(Your home, the name of a lake, etc.)
What type of water are you testing?
Tell us anything else you think would be helpful (optional).
Please select a water body type.

Tap the Take Picture button below to bring up the camera and take a photo. Tap the Choose from Gallery button below to select a photo from the collection on your phone. When you have taken or selected a photo, we will analyze it and tell you the results.
There was a problem analyzing the test strip. Make sure everything is correctly lined up and try again.

Carefully, open a test strip and submerge the whole thing in the water for about 1 second. Take it out and start the timer. Prepare to take a photo when the timer is done by placing the strip on the card, carefully aligning the strip so it is turned the right way and lined up straight.
